item.title: Star Wars: Unlimited TCG Gets Its Own Pokemon Battle Academy-Style Intro Game
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Asmodee has taken a page out of the Pokemon playbook with its latest addition to the Star Wars: Unlimited TCG catalog. Intro Battle Hoth is a standalone experience geared toward new players of the official Star Wars trading card game. It's very similar in concept to Pokemon TCG: Battle Academy and Disney Lorcana: Gateway. The fast-paced spin on Star Wars: Unlimited is available now for $20. As an added bonus, the game is themed around the Battle of Hoth from The Empire Strikes Back.

Star Wars: Unlimited TCG - Intro Battle Hoth

$20

Intro Battle Hoth is a head-to-head game for two players that takes roughly 20 minutes to play. Asmodee recommends Star Wars: Unlimited for players ages 12 and up.

The $20 "New Player Game" comes with two pre-built, 50-card decks. Princess Leia and the Rebel forces must defend Echo Base from Darth Vader and his Imperial Army. Much like Pokemon Battle Academy, Intro Battle Hoth comes with an illustrated game board with labeled spots for cards.

There's also a full rulebook and all accessories needed to play. Here's the full list of contents inside the box:

  • 104 Cards
    • Princess Leia's Rebel Forces Deck
    • Darth Vader's Imperial Army Deck
  • Game Board
  • 57 Damage Counters
  • 2 Epic Action Counters
  • 1 Initiative Counter
  • 1 Rulebook
  • 1 Info Sheet

Star Wars: Unlimited TCG Boxes, Boosters, Decks

Star Wars: Unlimited TCG debuted in March 2024 with a 252-card set called Spark of Rebellion. Asmodee has since released four more sets, and the next one, Secrets of Power, is slated for November 7. The prolific card/board game manufacturer has already confirmed three Star Wars: Unlimited TCG sets for 2026: A Lawless Time, Ashes of the Empire, and. Homeworlds.

If you're interested in collecting Star Wars: Unlimited cards, we've rounded up the Booster Boxes, Prerelease Boxes, Spotlight Decks, and Starter Sets you can buy now below.

Browse by category:

  • Starter Sets
  • Spotlight Decks
  • Prerelease Boxes
  • 2025 Gift Box
  • Booster Boxes
  • Booster Packs
  • Carbonite Booster Boxes

Star Wars: Unlimited Starter Sets

The first three Star Wars: Unlimited sets had $35 Starter Sets with two pre-built decks.

Each Starter Set comes with two 50-card decks--10 of the cards are exclusive--and deck boxes with character art of the named leaders. The Starter Sets also come with a quickstart rules guide and various damage counters.

  • Shadows of the Galaxy: Moff Gideon / The Mandalorian -- $31.81 ($35)
  • Twilight of the Republic: Ahsoka / General Grevious -- $35
  • Spark of Rebellion: Luke Skywalker / Darth Vader -- Sold out

Star Wars: Unlimited Spotlight Decks

Asmodee ditched the Starter Sets for a pair of individual decks called Spotlight Decks in 2025.

Each Spotlight Deck comes with a 50-card deck--four of the cards are exclusive--and a booster pack with 16 cards. It's worth noting that the 50-card decks include some cards from previous sets. Each deck has a named leader

  • Legends of the Force
    • Darth Maul -- $25
    • Qui-Gon Jinn -- $25
  • Jump to Lightspeed
    • Han Solo -- $24
    • Boba Fett -- $28

Star Wars: Unlimited Spotlight Deck Displays

Spotlight Decks are also available in 6-packs. These are mainly designed for tournament play and for larger groups of friends, since you get three of each Spotlight Deck in the carton.

  • Secrets of Power -- $150 | November 7
    • 3 Padme Amidala Decks
    • 3 Chancellor Palpatine Decks
  • Legends of the Force -- $140 ($150)
    • 3 Darth Maul Decks
    • 3 Qui-Gon Jinn Decks
  • Jump to Lightspeed -- $117.49 ($150)
    • 3 Han Solo Decks
    • 3 Boba Fett Decks

Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Boxes

Booster Boxes come with 24 packs featuring 16 cards each for a total of 384 cards. Booster Packs retail for $6 each, so Booster Boxes net you four packs free at MSRP. That said, most of the Booster Boxes sell for around $90, which breaks down to less than $4/pack. The 2025 Booster Boxes are the cheapest right now, with Jump to Lightspeed sitting at $73 and Legends of the Force at $88. If you want the original Spark of Rebellion set, the Booster Box for $91 is the way to go.

Each Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Pack comes with: 9 common cards, 3 uncommon cards, 1 rare or legendary card, 1 leader, 1 base/token, and 1 foil card.

  • Legends of the Force (24 Packs) -- $88 ($120)
  • Jump to Lightspeed (24 Packs) -- $73 ($120)
  • Twilight of the Republic (24 Packs) -- $92 ($120)
  • Shadows of the Galaxy (24 Packs) -- $91.67 ($120)
  • Spark of Rebellion (24 Packs) -- $91 ($120)

Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Packs

  • Jump to Lightspeed -- $6
  • Shadows of the Galaxy -- $6.90
  • Spark of Rebellion -- $12.40

Star Wars: Unlimited Prerelease Boxes

Despite the moniker "Prerelease Box," these aren't exclusive, limited-time bundles. The Prerelease Box is essentially the Elite Trainer Box or MTG Bundle, albeit on a smaller (and cheaper) scale. Each Prerelease Box comes with six Booster Packs with 16 cards in each pack. You'll also get two exclusive promo codes for the Rebel and Empire leaders in the set. Along with the cards, Prerelease Boxes come with damage counters and a quickstart guide.

  • Legends of the Force -- $25 ($30)
  • Jump to Lightspeed -- $28 ($30)
  • Twilight of the Republic -- $30
  • Shadows of the Galaxy -- $38.50
  • Spark of Rebellion -- Sold out

Star Wars: Unlimited 2025 Gift Box

On November 5, Asmodee is releasing a 2025 Gift Box for Star Wars: Unlimited. It's not available to preorder at Amazon, but you can secure one from Walmart. The Gift Box is $30 and includes eight Booster Packs, two exclusive variant cards, and an oversized leader card. You'll get two Boosters from each of the following sets: Secrets of Power, Legends of the Force, Jump to Lightspeed, Twilight of the Republic.

item.title: DayZ Dev Slams Valve For Using Gambling Mechanics In Games
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Aside from its massive success with Steam, Valve has also benefited from the longevity of Counter-Strike and Counter-Strike 2, which fueled massive in-game marketplaces. However, Dean Hall--the creator of DayZ and Icarus--believes that Valve should be taken to task for using gambling mechanics like loot boxes to monetize Counter-Strike 2.

"It's something I think Valve does not get anywhere near enough criticism about," Hall told Eurogamer. "I'm honestly disgusted with gambling mechanics in video games at all--they have absolutely no place. My challenge to game developers is that if they think these things are not a problem, they make the data available to universities who are crying out to study this stuff."

Loot boxes have largely fallen out of favor in the industry, especially after many attempts to legislate or ban them entirely. In Counter-Strike 2, loot boxes can contain desirable objects like weapon or armor skins that can be traded or resold for real money. But there is often no guarantee that the loot boxes contain the items players want. If players are spending real money to purchase loot boxes over and over again to find what they're looking for, it could be considered a form of gambling.

Earlier this year, Activision's Overwatch 2 restored loot boxes to the franchise, but with changes to increase transparency of how the loot boxes work, as well as offering a guarantee that an item of Rare or better quality can be found in every loot box. Activision's Heathstone helped usher in the age of loot boxes in 2014, and suffered a backlash because of it.

Last week, Valve updated the original Counter-Strike, which tanked the in-game re-seller market for weapons, and reportedly wiped out roughly $1.75 billion in value from sellers. Outside of the game, a planned fan-remake of Counter-Strike, Counter-Strike: Legacy, has reportedly run into some trouble with Valve, and may be shut down.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Fortnite Simpsons Live Event: Start Time, Rewards, And Everything Else To Know
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fortnite's worst kept secret--the upcoming Simpsons-themed season, which leaked back in the spring--is fast approaching, and at this point, Epic is officially teasing it. But there's still a little bit of time left in Chapter 6 Season 4, and the final full season of Chapter 6 is going out with a bang. That is, we're getting a live season finale event in Fortnite Battle Royale this weekend that will usher in the all-Simpsons season. Here's what you need to know about Fortnite's next big live event.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • When is the Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 4 finale live event taking place?
  • When will the Fortnite Simpsons season start?
  • How to participate in the Fortnite Simpsons live event
  • Fortnite season finale event tease
  • What will happen during the event?
  • Will there be any rewards for showing up to the Fortnite x Simpsons event?
  • What to expect from Fortnite's Simpsons season

When is the Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 4 finale live event taking place?

The live event is slated to begin on Saturday, November 1 at 8 AM PT / 11AM ET. That's three hours earlier than the usual start time for these things, so plan accordingly. After the event ends, Fortnite will go offline for maintenance in order to deploy the season update.

When will the Fortnite Simpsons season start?

Epic Games is planning for the new season to start on Saturday evening at 2 PM PT / 5 PM ET. Fortnite is expected to be offline for about five hours. But that start time is not firm--it could start earlier or later, depending on how maintenance goes.

How to participate in the Fortnite Simpsons live event

There won't be any confusion about how to join up for the event on Saturday, because when the event starts at 11 AM ET it will be the only mode in Fortnite available to play. You may want to boot up early, though, in case there's a login queue.

Fortnite season finale event tease

Epic and The Simpsons have both begun teasing the event with a small video that shows Simpsonized versions of Jonesy and Hope being abducted by Kang and Kodos.

What will happen during the event?

We don't really know any concrete details about what'll happen during the event, but since the final story quest of the season pointed us to the recently sprouted Treehouse of Horror at the edge of the island, whatever it is should take place there.

The live event is not, however, exclusively a teaser for the Simpsons season. It is also the end of the Chapter 6 Season 4 story, which saw a bunch of bugs invade the island before we ran them off with Megazord--and then Doja Cat and Jason Voorhees showed up. So while we know the event will bring the Simpsons into the game, we don't know much about how we'll get from here to there.

Will there be any rewards for showing up to the Fortnite x Simpsons event?

Nothing has been announced yet, but it's likely there will be a free item or two granted to anyone who logs in on Saturday for the event. Our money is on the Kang and Kodos glider that was added to the game in the last major update, since the flavor text on that item is a joke about them being left out of the battle pass.

What to expect from Fortnite's Simpsons season

There will be a Simpsons-themed battle pass and a takeover of the map, though we don't yet know how extensive the changes will be. You can read all the details we currently know about the new season here.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-simpsons-live-event-start-time-rewards-and-everything-else-to-know/1100-6535750/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: New Art Book Explores How Treyarch Created Call of Duty Zombies
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty has spent the better part of three decades as one of the biggest video game franchises, and much of that is thanks to the popularity of its recurring Zombies mode, which has been a major part of the series ever since 2008's Call of Duty: World at War. Since then, the mode has appeared in 13 Call of Duty games, including this year's upcoming Black Ops 7, launching November 7 on console and PC. To celebrate its enduring popularity, Call of Duty Zombies is getting its own dedicated hardcover art book, Call of Duty Zombies: The Art of Treyarch, that will explore Call of Duty: Zombies' evolution from a novel bonus to fan-favorite game mode. The book will launch on June 16, 2026, and preorders are available for $50 at Amazon.

Call of Duty Zombies: The Art of Treyarch

$50 | Releases June 16, 2026

This 256-page hardcover book examines the origins of this recurring mode, starting from its early days in 2008. You can expect to find exclusive behind-the-scenes interviews with the development team, artwork that has been locked in the Call of Duty vaults for years, and detailed intel on what it takes to make this core part of the Call of Duty franchise. The book is written by James Asmus, who has numerous writing credits for books, comic books, video games, and television.

Several Call of Duty books have been printed over the years, including other behind-the-scenes art books like Making Call of Duty: Modern Warfare. This 192-page hardcover book provides an in-depth look at the groundbreaking game's development, including the creation of characters, maps, and weapons. And while not technically an art book, you can also pick up the official Call of Duty: WWII Collector's Edition Guide that was published by Prima several years ago. The hardcover 304-page book has a ton of details on the campaign, multiplayer, and Zombies modes. It might be an odd purchase for an older COD game, but it's a cool bit of CoD history that's perfect for collectors and die-hard fans.

Along with these art books, there have also been a handful of stories based on recent Call of Duty games. If you're a fan of 2017's Call of Duty: WWII, then you'll want to check out this tie-in. The Call of Duty: WWII Field Manual is presented as a combat-issued handbook owned by Private Ronald "Red" Daniels. It's full of original illustrations, information on the game's units, vehicles, weapons, and battlegrounds, and it offers a first-hand look at various events that occurred during the campaign set in Axis-occupied France.

Several Call of Duty games also received official graphic novels created by talented teams of artists and writers, such as the Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 graphic nodel written by Larry Hama with illustrations by Marcelo Ferreira and Dan Jackson. The Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 - The Official Comic Collection features work Greg Rucka, Chris Roberson, Jeremy Barlow, K.A. McDonald, Aaron Duran, Matthew Robinson, and Tony Shasteen across 240 pages, and this hardcover is on sale for $19.18 (was $30). You can also read the entire Call of Duty: Vanguard tie-in comic book series thanks to the 112-page hardcover omnibus edition.

More Call of Duty books and graphic novels

  • Call of Duty Zombies: The Art of Treyarch -- $50 | Releases June 16, 2026
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 - Official Comic Prequel -- $18 ($20)
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 - The Official Comic Collection -- $19.18 ($30)
  • Call of Duty: Vanguard -- $17 ($20)
  • Call of Duty WWII: Field Manual -- $20 ($25)
  • Call of Duty: WWII: Prima Collector's Edition Guide -- $19.18 ($40)
  • Making Call of Duty: Modern Warfare -- $25 ($45)

Next month also sees Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 launch on PC and console. Preorders are open for the game ahead of its November 14 release, and early adopters can get bonus content for Call of Duty: Warzone. Like previous years, there'll be several different versions to choose from, ranging from the standard edition to a digital-only Vault Edition packed with exclusive DLC and early unlocks. For more information, you can check out our Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 preorder guide for a breakdown on what each version gets you.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Preorders
